Column Comment.0: OBLIGATION ID: Unique identifier for each obligation
Column Comment.1: OBLIGATION SEQ NO: Unique identifier for each part or occurrence of an obligation
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: OBLIGATION CALCULATION METHOD: the method used to calculate theobligation.
Column Comment.4: CONVERTIBLE INDICATOR: a yes / no flag indicating that the obligation isconvertable to a working interest.
Column Comment.5: CRITICAL DATE: Date which an obligation must be fulfilled
Column Comment.6: CURRENCY CONVERSION RATE: the rate applied to convert the currency from itsoriginal monetary UOM to the stored UOM. This value is valid for this row in this tableonly. When this value is multiplied by the STORED currency value, the original valueof the transaction in the original currency is obtained.
Column Comment.7: CURRENCY ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: the currency in which the funds wereinitially received. When the Stored currency is multiplied by the CURRENCYCONVERSION, the value of the transaction in the original currency is obtained.
Column Comment.8: DESCRIPTION: Description of the obligation or commitment
Column Comment.9: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which this row of data first came into effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.10: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.11: FULFILLED DATE: Date on which obligation was fulfilled
Column Comment.12: FULFILLED IND: Indicated whether or not obligation has been fulfilled. This may beused in the case where all rental payments over a five year period have been madein advance, and indicates that there are no additional obligations to incur.
Column Comment.13: GROSS OBLIGATION COST: Total payment amount required to fulfill the obligation
Column Comment.14: INSTRUMENT ID: Unique identifier for the instrument.
Column Comment.15: LIABILITY RELEASE DATE: the date that you are released from liability for thisobligation.
Column Comment.16: NET OBLIGATION COST: the net cost of the obligation, based on working interest.
Column Comment.17: NOTICE PERIOD LENGTH: Length of notice period required if this obligation is to beterminated. If the notice period is not adhered to, the obligation cannot be terminatedwithout fulfilling it.
Column Comment.18: NOTICE PERIOD ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: The original units used, usuallydays, months or years
Column Comment.19: R OBLIG CATEGORY: may include non-payment obligation, rental, lease or royalty
Column Comment.20: OBLIGATION DURATION: Length of time for which obligation is applicable
Column Comment.21: OBLIGATION DURATION ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: The original units used,usually days, months or years
Column Comment.22: OBLIGATION FREQUENCY: Frequency with which this obligation will be due(annual, monthly, single)
Column Comment.23: OBLIGATION TYPE: the type of obligation incurred, such as termination notice,surrender notice, annual rental
Column Comment.24: PAYMENT IND: Indicator to determine if obligation is payment or non-payment (Y=payment obligation)
Column Comment.25: OBLIGATION PAYMENT RESPONSIBILITY: Indicates whether the obligation is paidout entirely by one partner, each partner is responsible for paying only their share, orwhether a third party has been retained to make payments and charge back to eachpartner.
Column Comment.26: PERCENTAGE: The percentage of the Royalty payment obligation.
Column Comment.27: POTENTIAL OBLIGATION DESC: Description of the condition or event whichtriggers the obligation. Could be an SQL query which queries the database todetermine whether the condition has been met (typically related to cost andproduction re venue)
Column Comment.28: POTENTIAL OBLIGATION IND: Indicator to identify if it is a potential obligation.These are not currently obligations, but will become so when the obligationdescription has been fulfilled. (Y= potential obligation)
Column Comment.29: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.30: PREPAID IND: Indicates that all royalty obligations have been prepaid
Column Comment.31: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.32: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: the business associate who is responsible for ensuring thisobligation is fulfilled, such as ensuring rents are paid, reports generated etc.
Column Comment.33: REVIEW FREQUENCY: the frequency with which the obligation is reviewed todetermine whether it should be revised. Each revision increases the SEQ NO by one.
Column Comment.34: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: The business associate who will be paid the royalty
Column Comment.35: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: the business associate who is responsible for ensuring thatthe royalty is paid. Each payor is tracked separately in OBLIGATION PAYMENT.
Column Comment.36: R ROYALTY TYPE: a type of royalty, such as gross overriding,
Column Comment.37: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.38: START DATE: the date on which work to fulfill an obligations started. This could bewhen a work program was initiated or when a financial obligation was first paid.
Column Comment.39: SUBSTANCE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a substance that can be describedeither chemically or in terms of composition. Elements, ions, isotopes, isomers,minerals, chemicals, solvents, production substances, hydrocarbons etc are all listed.Be advised that many applications and agencies may use the same term, but thedefinition and composition details may not be the same. Use the SUBSTANCE XREFtable to capture relationships between substances, such as similar substances.
Column Comment.40: OBLIGATION TRIGGER METHOD: The means by which the obligation is triggered,and becomes active.
Column Comment.41: WORK OBLIGATION DESCRIPTION: Reports the numerical and functionalcomponent of the work obligation commitment. May be DRILL 3 WELLS, SHOOT 5SEISMIC LINES, EXPEND $5,000,000 etc. This should be derived from the LANDOFFERING BIG, if the obligation incurred as a result of land acquisition through landsale.
Column Comment.42: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.43: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.44: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.45: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.46: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.47: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.48: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
